events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the downtown streets, involving two vehicles with moderate damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to mention of vehicle collision and damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to directly communicate with the customer and oversee the claim process.
The customer received acknowledgment of the claim submission along with information on the next steps in the investigation.
The agent requested photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and a copy of the driver’s license to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including detailed images of the collision damage and required official reports.
The claims team began a thorough investigation of the accident circumstances and vehicle damages based on the submitted documentation.
The investigation concluded after verifying the authenticity of the documents and assessing the extent of damage on both vehicles.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repairs and rental car reimbursement following policy terms.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the timely communication throughout the process.
The claim was formally approved by the underwriting team, confirming all terms and conditions were met for payment processing.
The insurance payment was issued to the customer’s account to cover the vehicle repair costs and associated expenses as agreed.
The claim was formally closed after confirming receipt of payment and ensuring the customer had no further questions or issues.
All claim files and communications were archived in the system for record keeping and future reference if required.
